message.content: It is not accurate or fair to generalize the opinions of most women in Germany on divorce, as viewpoints can vary greatly depending on individual experiences and personal beliefs. However, divorce is generally seen as a more accepted and viable option for resolving marital issues in modern German society. Many women in Germany view divorce as a means to seek personal fulfillment, independence, and to prioritize their own well-being over an unhappy or dysfunctional marriage. There is also a general emphasis on gender equality, which has influenced women's perspectives on divorce, providing them with the freedom to make choices that align with their own happiness and self-fulfillment.
